com.quinsoft.zeidon

Interface AttributeInstance


  • public interface AttributeInstance
    Represents an attribute value in a Zeidon OI.

    The attribute value is stored internally and can be any object. The AttributeInstance can be used to convert the value to standard classes. When the value is set through an AttributeInstance the new value is verified (and possibly converted) by the associated domain.

    The AttributeInstance for an attribute is normally retrieved like this: 

     
 View myView = ...;
 AttributeInstance myAttr = myView.cursor( "MyEntity" ).getAttribute( "MyAttribute" );
 String strValue = myAttr.getString();

    • Method Detail

      • getAttributeDef

        AttributeDef getAttributeDef()
        Returns the AttributeDef for this attribute.
        Returns:
        the AttributeDef for this attribute.

      • getEntityInstance

        EntityInstance getEntityInstance()
        Returns the EntityInstance that contains this attribute.
        Returns:
        the EntityInstance that contains this attribute.

      • getString

        String getString()
        Returns the internal attribute value as a string. Note that no context is used to convert the string. If you want to use the default context call getString( "" ) instead.
        Returns:
        the internal attribute value as a string.

      • getInteger

        Integer getInteger()
        Returns the attribute value as an integer if possible. Otherwise throws InvalidAttributeValueException.
        Returns:
        the attribute value as an integer.
        Throws:
        InvalidAttributeValueException

      • getDateTime

        ZonedDateTime getDateTime()
        Returns the attribute value as a ZonedDateTime if possible. Otherwise throws InvalidAttributeValueException. Note that no context is used to convert the ZonedDateTime. If you want to use the default context call getDateTime( "" ) instead.
        Returns:
        the attribute value as a ZonedDateTime.
        Throws:
        InvalidAttributeValueException

      • getDouble

        Double getDouble()
        Returns the attribute value as an double if possible. Otherwise throws InvalidAttributeValueException.
        Returns:
        the attribute value as an double.
        Throws:
        InvalidAttributeValueException

      • getBoolean

        Boolean getBoolean()
        Returns the attribute value as an boolean if possible. Otherwise throws InvalidAttributeValueException.
        Returns:
        the attribute value as an boolean.
        Throws:
        InvalidAttributeValueException

      • getString

        String getString(String contextName)
        Returns the internal attribute value as a string. The supplied contextName will be used to convert the value. To specify the default context use "" (empty string).
        Returns:
        the internal attribute value as a string.

      • getInteger

        Integer getInteger(String contextName)
        Returns the attribute value as an integer if possible. Otherwise throws InvalidAttributeValueException. The supplied contextName will be used to convert the value. To specify the default context use "" (empty string).
        Returns:
        the attribute value as an integer.
        Throws:
        InvalidAttributeValueException

      • getDateTime

        Returns:
        the attribute value as a ZonedDateTime.
        Throws:

        Returns:
        the attribute value as an double.
        Throws:

        Returns:
        the attribute value as an boolean.
        Throws:

      • getBlob

        Blob getBlob()

      • getInternalAttributeValue

        @Deprecated
Object getInternalAttributeValue()
        Deprecated. Use getValue() instead.

      • getValue

        Object getValue()
        Returns the internal object that represents the attribute value. For most attributes the value will be immutable or it will be a copy of the value. Attribute values can only be changed via setValue().
        Returns:
        attribute value.

      • setValue

        EntityInstance setValue(Object value)
                 throws InvalidAttributeValueException
        Set the attribute value to 'value'. This uses domain processing to validate and potential convert the value to the internal representation.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to set
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        InvalidAttributeValueException

      • setValue

        EntityInstance setValue(Object value,
                        String contextName)
                 throws InvalidAttributeValueException
        Set the attribute value to 'value'. This uses domain processing to validate and potential convert the value to the internal representation. If contextName is supplied it will be used to help in the conversion.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to set
        contextName - the name of the context.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        InvalidAttributeValueException

      • setDerivedValue

        EntityInstance setDerivedValue(Object value)
        Sets the value of the attribute without attempting to convert it first. This still validates that the value is well-formed. This is intended to be used inside derived operations to set the value.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        this

      • add

        EntityInstance add(Object value)
        Add a value to the current attribute value. What "add" means is domain-specific. For example, for string domains it will likely mean concatenation.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to add to the attribute
        Returns:
        this

      • add

        EntityInstance add(Object value,
                   String contextName)
        Add a value to the current attribute value with a context. What "add" means is domain-specific. For example, for string domains it will likely mean concatenation. The context name is also domain-specific.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to add to the attribute
        Returns:
        this

      • multiply

        EntityInstance multiply(Object value)
        Multiply an attribute by a value. What "multiply" means is domain-specific.
        Parameters:
        value - the current attribute value will be multiplied by this value.
        Returns:
        this

      • setInternalValue

        boolean setInternalValue(Object value,
                         boolean setIncremental)
        Sets the value of the attribute without attempting to convert it first. This still validates that the value is well-formed.
        Parameters:
        value -
        setIncremental - if 'false' then don't update attribute/entity update flags.
        Returns:
        true if the value was updated, false if it wasn't (i.e. current value matches value).

      • compare

        int compare(Object value)
        Compares the attribute to 'value'. This will using domain processing to convert the value to the same type as the attribute.
        Parameters:
        value - to be compared.
        Returns:
        -1, 0, or 1

      • isNull

        boolean isNull()
        Determines if the attribute value is null.
        Returns:
        true if attribute value is null.

      • isBlank

        boolean isBlank()
        Returns true if attribute value is: Null -or- Comparison with "" is true (which is domain-specific). -or- String value is all white-space.
        Returns:
        true if Null, empty string, or whitespace.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if attribute value is: Null -or- Comparison with "" is true (which is domain-specific).
        Returns:
        true if Null or empty string.

      • isUpdated

        boolean isUpdated()
        Determines if the attribute value has been updated since it was loaded from the database. I.e. this can be considered as a 'dirty' flag. If the OI is committed this attribute will be updated.
        Returns:
        true if attribute has been updated.

      • setIsUpdated

        EntityInstance setIsUpdated(boolean isUpdated)

      • getView

        View getView()
        Returns a view associated with this attribute instance. Note that this may cause a view to be created.
        Returns:
        the owning view.

      • getTask

        Task getTask()
        Return the owning task.
        Returns:
        the owning task.
